author: Special Correspondent
text:
Condemning an undeclared power cut in their area at midnight on Thursday, a section of the residents of ward 40 staged a road roko in the wee hours of Friday.

As power supply was interrupted in their area at midnight, around 50 persons, led by councillor Kalaiselvi of Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam, staged a road roko in front the old bus stand around 12.30 a.m. on Friday.

Reasons

While Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation officials argued that the power cut was due to simultaneous operation of motors for drawing water from domestic drinking water connections, the residents rejected it, saying poor maintenance of equipment and breakdown at units of Tuticorn Thermal Power Plant (TTPS) were the prime reasons.

After the Tahildar, Chandran, came to the spot and pacified the protesters, the agitation was withdrawn around 1 a.m.
title: Residents block road after midnight power cut
